body.name: Amazon Basics Dynamic Vocal Microphone, Cardioid, XLR, Black, Silver
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 10 mins
features: Dynamic cardioid microphone for vocal amplification
Cardioid pick up pattern and built-in spherical wind and pop filter for separating background noise and delivering clear sound
Great for everyday or occasional use such as live musical performances, public speaking, podcasts, recording sessions and more
Durable zinc die cast housing with matte enamel finish and steel mesh head
Easy to connect and use with included single male XLR cable and simple on/off switch

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value microphone
reviews.reviewText: This is a great value microphone for my basic announcer needs on a PA system. Sound quality is clear enough, but because it's an entry level microphone do not expect super sharp or clear sound as you would from a higher end company like Shure. That said, for the price this will meet most amateur to semi-professional needs in my opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Anything but Basic
reviews.reviewText: Sturdy build quality.Possesses premium heft.I am going to say this to keep it short. I did Prince, Whitney Houston, Michael Jackson.I do pretty accurate impressions. No to none hearable pop.So, this is your mic unless you make money from music.Amazon is taking shots at someone, I just don't know who.So, to the customer. This is a great deal for just fartin around with friends.However, you will have to train up considerably to out grow this mic.Great entry level even to mastery.Has excellent sound rejection.Has very clean sound when directed into mic.I can yell, do rock, tenor songs, belters, and even impressions.I am on Smule and I can not believe the stinking quality.Lastly, my voice improved because I no longer need to push my voice so hard. It takes the smallest drip of sound. Peace

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Buy it or Not 🤔
reviews.reviewText: I have been using this in my studio as a extra for guests when my compression microphones are all being used on my podcast (Studio B.E.E.) for about a year, arguably, maybe more. Have had no issues with this mic, works excellent, and is beyond worth the $$$$ depending upon what you are using it for.Personally, I would NOT use this for vocals (singing), or music, unless your budget is really tight. It may be great for recording high range instruments such a guitar, chimes, tambourines, ect..... but not low range such as a bass drum, or base guitar. I doubt it will do the lower range any TRUE justice, even though it may sound ok.However, it's a perfect starter or guest mic! Always good to have around 👌 😌.We bought it, and still use it next to our expensive microphones all the time.Not a bad Buy in our opinion!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great price, quality mic, mic clip and cable
reviews.reviewText: Took this out of the box and the weight surprised me. This thing is metal and has some heft to it. Feels good in the hand, very much like Sennheiser, AKG, EV, Shure etc. Comes with a mic clip and a long mic cable.The mic clip exhibits a little rubbery flex, a good thing, considering how easily cheaper clips break from being too brittle.The cable is female XLR on one end and 1/4" unbalanced TS on the other. I wish both ends were XLR. Even more, I wish they were right angled XLRs.When are you getting in the right angle and low profile XLR game AMZ?The mic sounds fine. I plan to use it at events where people are making speeches. As a musician, I wouldn't exclude it from use as a vocal mic, in the absence of the ones I'm familiar with.One negative I notice, is that an Amazon Basics XLR does not 'click' on to this mic. While it does lock, I do not hear that confirmatory click I'm used to with my other mics.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Really good mic! And xlr cord came with EXCELLENT buy! Actually I’m getting another one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It took me a while but finally found a great microphone!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars GREAT BUILD QUALITY, amateur, naïve, mediocre sound.
reviews.reviewText: This mic doesn't sound the best. And that's expected 20 dollar microphone. But with shipping and tax, (without shipping) costing 30 dollars, is not a good deal. If you're looking for a streaming/recording microphone, spit up an extra 10 dollars and just go for fifine. Better option.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Far exceeded my expectations. I'm a karaoke host who needs a versatile inexpensive microphone. I was expecting okay performance, and was rewarded by surprisingly good sound for the money!I will be purchasing more just to have a spares.

this microphone is unbeatable for the price, build quality matches of the most notable brands, and sound quality is lacking if you don't have external power like a mixer or phantom power supply, but I use this on a mixer and it sounds just as good as all of my name brand microphones
Pareciera está empresa le vende a SHURE y ya solo le ponen su marca y uno que otro adorno.El sonido es claro y nítido.

reviews.reviewTitle: Su sonido cristalino buena calidad por el precio
reviews.reviewText: Siendo de Amazon esperaba esa calidad

reviews.reviewText: Perfect for what I need. Sound quality was good when plugged into my DJ mixer
